org.transitime.core

Class VehicleState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.core.VehicleState

  • public class VehicleState
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of vehicle state including its block assignment, where it last matched to its assignment, and AVL reports.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

        Member Functions

    • Method Detail

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(Block block,
            BlockAssignmentMethod assignmentMethod,
            boolean predictable)
        Sets the block assignment for vehicle. Also, this is how it is specified whether a vehicle is predictable or not.
        Parameters:
        block - The current block assignment for the vehicle
        assignmentMethod - How vehicle was assigned (AVL feed, auto assigner, etc)
        predictable - Whether vehicle is predictable

      • setMatch

        public void setMatch(TemporalMatch match)
        Sets the match for the vehicle into the history. If set to null then VehicleState.predictable is set to false.
        Parameters:
        match -

      • setAvlReport

        public void setAvlReport(AvlReport avlReport)
        Stores the specified avlReport into the history for the vehicle. Makes sure that the AVL history doesn't exceed maximum size.
        Parameters:
        avlReport -

      • getLastMatch

        public TemporalMatch getLastMatch()
        Returns the last temporal match. Returns null if there isn't one.
        Returns:

      • getTrip

        public Trip getTrip()
        Returns the current Trip for the vehicle. Returns null if there is not current trip.
        Returns:
        Trip or null.

      • getRouteId

        public java.lang.String getRouteId()
        Returns the current route ID for the vehicle. Returns null if not currently associated with a trip.
        Returns:
        Route ID or null.

      • getRouteShortName

        public java.lang.String getRouteShortName()
        Returns the current route short name for the vehicle. Returns null if not currently associated with a trip.
        Returns:
        route short name or null

      • atLayover

        public boolean atLayover()
        Returns true if last temporal match for vehicle indicates that it is at a layover.
        Returns:
        true if at a layover

      • getPreviousToLastMatch

        public TemporalMatch getPreviousToLastMatch()
        Returns the next to last temporal match. Returns null if there isn't one. Useful for when need to compare the previous to last match with the last one, such as for determining if vehicle has transversed any stops.
        Returns:

      • getLastAvlReport

        public AvlReport getLastAvlReport()
        Returns the last AvlReport. Returns null if there isn't one.
        Returns:

      • getPreviousToLastAvlReport

        public AvlReport getPreviousToLastAvlReport()
        Returns the next to last AvlReport. Returns null if there isn't one.
        Returns:

      • hasNewBlockAssignment

        public boolean hasNewBlockAssignment(AvlReport avlReport)
        Returns true if the AVL report has a different block assignment than what is in the VehicleState. For when reassigning a vehicle via the AVL feed.
        Parameters:
        avlReport -
        Returns:

      • getMatches

        public java.util.List<TemporalMatch> getMatches()
        Returns an unmodifiable list of the match history. The most recent one is first. The size of the list will be not greater than MATCH_HISTORY_SIZE.
        Returns:
        the match history

      • setVehicleAtStopInfo

        public void setVehicleAtStopInfo(VehicleAtStopInfo vehicleAtStopInfo)

      • getVehicleAtStopInfo

        public VehicleAtStopInfo getVehicleAtStopInfo()
        Note: this is different from whether the SpatialMatch is currently at a stop. The SpatialMatch simply looks at the current stop indicated by the path index to determine if it is at that stop. But vehicleAtStopInfo keeps track of which stop the vehicle is on with respect to arrivals/departures. It could match to a previous stop if the allowable distance after the stop is large, such as for a terminal.
        Returns:

      • setPredictions

        public void setPredictions(java.util.List<Prediction> predictions)
        Sets the current list of predictions for the vehicle to the predictions parameter.
        Parameters:
        predictions -
